UI.noInput: Please answer before viewing the solution

question: What is the best way to print a very long string?

answers.text:
Break up the string into multiple smaller strings. 
print("..." # first part of string
"..." # next part of string
"...")

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: Assigning the string to a variable still results in a very long line of code.

answers.text:
Print the string using multiple print statements. 
print("...") # first part of string
print("...") # next part of string
print("...")

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: This is one way to print a long string, but is less efficient, because print needs to run multiple times.

answers.text:
Assign the string to a variable and print the variable. 
text = "..." # the entire string
print(text)

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: Using one print statement with parentheses joins the lines implicitly and does not increase the number of statements.

detailedSolution: Using one print statement with parentheses joins the lines implicitly and does not increase the number of statements.
